title: Burrow's Black Friday Sale Includes the Small Space-Friendly Sleeper Sofa We Lov
description: Plus more deals at up to 50% off! READ MORE...
author: Morgan Pryor
excerpt: Plus more deals at up to 50% off!
text: DecoratingFurnitureShoppingWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.It seems like every year, the holiday season kicks off earlier and earlier. A good portion of people have already completely decked out their homes in holiday gear — I’m sure others were already done the day after Halloween. The decorations aren’t the only thing that marks the early shift to the festive season: Brands have also been rolling out their Black Friday deals over the past week. No more having to frantically sift through hundreds of products on the actual day. Instead, you have the luxury of taking your time and evaluating all of your options.Target, Walmart, Castlery, Wayfair — and now Burrow have all joined the ranks of brands offering huge discounts on home essentials. That’s excellent news if new furniture is on your Black Friday wish list —  you can score a top-notch piece at up to 50% off. Burrow is a favorite among our editors, with even our own editor-in-chief swearing by its “unbelievably comfortable” sleeper sofa. Keep reading to find out what else she has to say about it and nine other items worth grabbing during the sale.1 / 10Burrow$1679.00was $2099.00“This sleeper sofa is a true small space game-changer,” says AT’s editor-in-chief, Charli, about the Shift Sleeper. “It’s unbelievably comfortable both as a couch and a pull-out bed for guests. With two people, it was a breeze to put together, and it added an immediate wow factor to our cozy space. The quality is outstanding, and the built-in bed is more comfortable than any sleeper sofa I’ve ever slept on. It’s the perfect double duty piece for anyone who occasionally needs a living room to double as a bedroom. Five stars!”2 / 10Burrow$469.00was $549.00Named Burrow’s best chair for small spaces in our Personal Shopper series, the Pica made a big impression on shopping writer Nikol, despite its compact frame. If you’re filling a tight corner with a reading chair or furnishing a tiny studio, the curved backrest and gorgeous fabric (bouclé or velvet) will make it your favorite relaxation spot.3 / 10Burrow$1449.00was $1599.00This stunning bed frame earned a spot in Commerce Editor Britt’s space, who loves how easy it was to assemble. “The bed frame doesn’t shift, wobble, or squeak when I am on it,” she says. “I’ve even propped pillows up against the headboard while on my laptop in bed, and it doesn’t feel like I’m bending the board back at all while resting on it. Plus, it has single center-leg support, which leaves a ton of room for under-bed storage.”4 / 10Burrow$382.00was $499.00If your current coffee table doesn’t have built-in storage, this is your sign to grab one that does. This one is even more amazing than most because the tabletop is made of three removable slabs of wood, which become trays for your lap. Genius!5 / 10Burrow$1449.00was $1699.00The Range sectional can be rearranged, which means it’s endlessly versatile. That was a big selling point for our tester, Madeline. “It’s just the right amount of firm so you don’t feel like you’re sinking into it, yet it’s surprisingly soft for such an angular style of sofa,” she adds. “Two years later, I’m still kicking back on it nightly to watch Wheel of Fortune and Jeopardy.”6 / 10Burrow$1019.00was $1199.00With its zero-gravity surface technology and five layers, which include coils on top of foam, the Lyric mattress was a winner for our contributor, Stella. “I’m not exaggerating when I say that my back now feels magically painless (my boyfriend even noticed he was waking up free of the back pain he hadn’t realized even he’d been suffering from),” her review reads.7 / 10Burrow$254.00was $299.00A rolling cart is a staple for every space, whether it holds plants, cooking gear, office supplies, or bar essentials. This one can do it all in style, not looking a bit out of place with the rest of your decor. In fact, with its wooden shelves and metal frame, it’ll elevate the rest of your space.8 / 10Burrow$679.00was $799.00This bookcase has a simple design, and that’s what makes it look totally luxe. The open shelving allows you to show off all of your decor, books, or knickknacks, and if you end up wanting even more storage space, you can buy another and connect them together, creating a seamless library wall.9 / 10Burrow$369.00was $429.00This is one of Burrow’s “most durable, low maintenance, and easy-to-clean” rugs, so whether you put it inside or outside, you know that you’ll get your money’s worth. The subtle chevron pattern adds some dimension visually, and the weave is designed to not snag on your pet’s claws.10 / 10Burrow$3299.00was $4399.00“You don’t even need a pull-out sleeper when you have the five-seat Union sectional in your living room,” says Nikol, who tried this deep-seat sofa for Personal Shopper. “You’ll find the Union sectional’s seats to be soft but supportive, so you won’t feel like you’re sinking into a pit; plus, the sofa will keep its traditional shape over time.”Apartment Therapy's Home RunsGet full reviews of editor-favorite finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
html:
• Decorating
  • Furniture
  • Shopping

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

It seems like every year, the holiday season kicks off earlier and earlier. A good portion of people have already completely decked out their homes in holiday gear — I’m sure others were already done the day after Halloween. The decorations aren’t the only thing that marks the early shift to the festive season: Brands have also been rolling out their Black Friday deals over the past week. No more having to frantically sift through hundreds of products on the actual day. Instead, you have the luxury of taking your time and evaluating all of your options.

Target, Walmart, Castlery, Wayfair — and now Burrow have all joined the ranks of brands offering huge discounts on home essentials. That’s excellent news if new furniture is on your Black Friday wish list —  you can score a top-notch piece at up to 50% off. Burrow is a favorite among our editors, with even our own editor-in-chief swearing by its “unbelievably comfortable” sleeper sofa. Keep reading to find out what else she has to say about it and nine other items worth grabbing during the sale.

1 / 10

Burrow

$1679.00

was $2099.00

“This sleeper sofa is a true small space game-changer,” says AT’s editor-in-chief, Charli, about the Shift Sleeper. “It’s unbelievably comfortable both as a couch and a pull-out bed for guests. With two people, it was a breeze to put together, and it added an immediate wow factor to our cozy space. The quality is outstanding, and the built-in bed is more comfortable than any sleeper sofa I’ve ever slept on. It’s the perfect double duty piece for anyone who occasionally needs a living room to double as a bedroom. Five stars!”

2 / 10

Burrow

$469.00

was $549.00

Named Burrow’s best chair for small spaces in our Personal Shopper series, the Pica made a big impression on shopping writer Nikol, despite its compact frame. If you’re filling a tight corner with a reading chair or furnishing a tiny studio, the curved backrest and gorgeous fabric (bouclé or velvet) will make it your favorite relaxation spot.

3 / 10

Burrow

$1449.00

was $1599.00

This stunning bed frame earned a spot in Commerce Editor Britt’s space, who loves how easy it was to assemble. “The bed frame doesn’t shift, wobble, or squeak when I am on it,” she says. “I’ve even propped pillows up against the headboard while on my laptop in bed, and it doesn’t feel like I’m bending the board back at all while resting on it. Plus, it has single center-leg support, which leaves a ton of room for under-bed storage.”

4 / 10

Burrow

$382.00

was $499.00

If your current coffee table doesn’t have built-in storage, this is your sign to grab one that does. This one is even more amazing than most because the tabletop is made of three removable slabs of wood, which become trays for your lap. Genius!

5 / 10

Burrow

$1449.00

was $1699.00

The Range sectional can be rearranged, which means it’s endlessly versatile. That was a big selling point for our tester, Madeline. “It’s just the right amount of firm so you don’t feel like you’re sinking into it, yet it’s surprisingly soft for such an angular style of sofa,” she adds. “Two years later, I’m still kicking back on it nightly to watch Wheel of Fortune and Jeopardy.”

6 / 10

Burrow

$1019.00

was $1199.00

With its zero-gravity surface technology and five layers, which include coils on top of foam, the Lyric mattress was a winner for our contributor, Stella. “I’m not exaggerating when I say that my back now feels magically painless (my boyfriend even noticed he was waking up free of the back pain he hadn’t realized even he’d been suffering from),” her review reads.

7 / 10

Burrow

$254.00

was $299.00

A rolling cart is a staple for every space, whether it holds plants, cooking gear, office supplies, or bar essentials. This one can do it all in style, not looking a bit out of place with the rest of your decor. In fact, with its wooden shelves and metal frame, it’ll elevate the rest of your space.

8 / 10

Burrow

$679.00

was $799.00

This bookcase has a simple design, and that’s what makes it look totally luxe. The open shelving allows you to show off all of your decor, books, or knickknacks, and if you end up wanting even more storage space, you can buy another and connect them together, creating a seamless library wall.

9 / 10

Burrow

$369.00

was $429.00

This is one of Burrow’s “most durable, low maintenance, and easy-to-clean” rugs, so whether you put it inside or outside, you know that you’ll get your money’s worth. The subtle chevron pattern adds some dimension visually, and the weave is designed to not snag on your pet’s claws.

10 / 10

Burrow

$3299.00

was $4399.00

“You don’t even need a pull-out sleeper when you have the five-seat Union sectional in your living room,” says Nikol, who tried this deep-seat sofa for Personal Shopper. “You’ll find the Union sectional’s seats to be soft but supportive, so you won’t feel like you’re sinking into a pit; plus, the sofa will keep its traditional shape over time.”
